intro: Ruellia eumorphantha, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect perennial with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Ruellia eumorphantha is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to attract pollinators.
